Behold, thou art fair<S>3303</S>, my love<S>7474</S>; behold, thou art fair<S>3303</S>; thou hast doves'<S>3123</S> eyes<S>5869</S> within<S>1157</S> thy locks<S>6777</S>: thy hair<S>8181</S> is as a flock<S>5739</S> of goats<S>5795</S>, that appear<S>1570</S> from mount<S>2022</S> Gilead<S>1568</S>. <sup>that: or, that eat of, etc</sup>
Thy teeth<S>8127</S> are like a flock<S>5739</S> of sheep that are even shorn<S>7094</S>, which came up<S>5927</S> from the washing<S>7367</S>; whereof every one bear twins<S>8382</S>, and none is barren<S>7909</S> among them.
Thy lips<S>8193</S> are like a thread<S>2339</S> of scarlet<S>8144</S>, and thy speech<S>4057</S> is comely<S>5000</S>: thy temples<S>7541</S> are like a piece<S>6400</S> of a pomegranate<S>7416</S> within<S>1157</S> thy locks<S>6777</S>.
Thy neck<S>6677</S> is like the tower<S>4026</S> of David<S>1732</S> builded<S>1129</S> for an armoury<S>8530</S>, whereon there hang<S>8518</S> a thousand<S>505</S> bucklers<S>4043</S>, all shields<S>7982</S> of mighty men<S>1368</S>.
Thy two<S>8147</S> breasts<S>7699</S> are like two<S>8147</S> young<S>6082</S> roes<S>6646</S> that are twins<S>8380</S>, which feed<S>7462</S> among the lilies<S>7799</S>.
Until the day<S>3117</S> break<S>6315</S>, and the shadows<S>6752</S> flee away<S>5127</S>, I will get<S>3212</S> me to the mountain<S>2022</S> of myrrh<S>4753</S>, and to the hill<S>1389</S> of frankincense<S>3828</S>. <sup>break: Heb. breathe</sup>
Thou art all fair<S>3303</S>, my love<S>7474</S>; there is no spot<S>3971</S> in thee.
Come<S>935</S> with me from Lebanon<S>3844</S>, my spouse<S>3618</S>, with me from Lebanon<S>3844</S>: look<S>7789</S> from the top<S>7218</S> of Amana<S>549</S>, from the top<S>7218</S> of Shenir<S>8149</S> and Hermon<S>2768</S>, from the lions'<S>738</S> dens<S>4585</S>, from the mountains<S>2042</S> of the leopards<S>5246</S>.
Thou hast ravished my heart<S>3823</S>, my sister<S>269</S>, my spouse<S>3618</S>; thou hast ravished my heart<S>3823</S> with one<S>259</S> of thine eyes<S>5869</S>, with one<S>259</S> chain<S>6060</S> of thy neck<S>6677</S>. <sup>ravished: or, taken away</sup>
How fair<S>3302</S> is thy love<S>1730</S>, my sister<S>269</S>, my spouse<S>3618</S>! how much better<S>2895</S> is thy love<S>1730</S> than wine<S>3196</S>! and the smell<S>7381</S> of thine ointments<S>8081</S> than all spices<S>1314</S>!
Thy lips<S>8193</S>, O my spouse<S>3618</S>, drop<S>5197</S> as the honeycomb<S>5317</S>: honey<S>1706</S> and milk<S>2461</S> are under thy tongue<S>3956</S>; and the smell<S>7381</S> of thy garments<S>8008</S> is like the smell<S>7381</S> of Lebanon<S>3844</S>.
A garden<S>1588</S> inclosed<S>5274</S> is my sister<S>269</S>, my spouse<S>3618</S>; a spring<S>1530</S> shut up<S>5274</S>, a fountain<S>4599</S> sealed<S>2856</S>. <sup>inclosed: Heb. barred</sup> <sup>shut up: Heb. barred</sup>
Thy plants<S>7973</S> are an orchard<S>6508</S> of pomegranates<S>7416</S>, with pleasant<S>4022</S> fruits<S>6529</S>; camphire<S>3724</S>, with spikenard<S>5373</S>, <sup>camphire: or, cypress</sup>
Spikenard<S>5373</S> and saffron<S>3750</S>; calamus<S>7070</S> and cinnamon<S>7076</S>, with all trees<S>6086</S> of frankincense<S>3828</S>; myrrh<S>4753</S> and aloes<S>174</S>, with all the chief<S>7218</S> spices<S>1314</S>:
A fountain<S>4599</S> of gardens<S>1588</S>, a well<S>875</S> of living<S>2416</S> waters<S>4325</S>, and streams<S>5140</S> from Lebanon<S>3844</S>.
Awake<S>5782</S>, O north wind<S>6828</S>; and come<S>935</S>, thou south<S>8486</S>; blow<S>6315</S> upon my garden<S>1588</S>, that the spices<S>1314</S> thereof may flow out<S>5140</S>. Let my beloved<S>1730</S> come<S>935</S> into his garden<S>1588</S>, and eat<S>398</S> his pleasant<S>4022</S> fruits<S>6529</S>.
